sections.title: Chapter One
sections.body:
The metronome ticked in the dim study, keeping time with a heart that never seemed to sleep.

He ran a thumb along the cracked spine of a book he'd read a dozen times, its margins crowded with notes that only half made sense now.

Outside, the rain pressed its face against the glass. Inside, the work pressed closer.
footnotes: The metronome was a gift from a friend who no longer wrote letters.
The book was borrowed, never returned.

sections.title: A Minor Interlude
sections.body:
We promised to write more often,
but the ink dried quicker than resolve.
Still, we keep the paper near the lamp,
and the lamp lit.
